014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.List;
018import java.util.Optional;
019import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
020import java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.array.SqlArrayMapperFactory;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.enums.internal.EnumMapperFactory;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
027import org.jdbi.v3.core.interceptor.JdbiInterceptionChainHolder;
028import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.JdbiOptionals;
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
030import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Alpha;
031
032/**
033 * Configuration registry for {@link ColumnMapperFactory} instances.
034 */
035public class ColumnMappers implements JdbiConfig<ColumnMappers> {
036
037    private final JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<ColumnMapper<?>, QualifiedColumnMapperFactory> inferenceInterceptors =
038        new JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<>(InferredColumnMapperFactory::new);
039
040    private final List<QualifiedColumnMapperFactory> factories = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
041    private final ConcurrentHashMap<QualifiedType<?>, Optional<? extends ColumnMapper<?>>> cache = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
042
043    private boolean coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults = true;
044    private ConfigRegistry registry;
045
046    public ColumnMappers() {
047        register(new SqlArrayMapperFactory());
048        register(new JavaTimeMapperFactory());
049        register(new SqlTimeMapperFactory());
050        register(new InternetMapperFactory());
051        register(new EssentialsMapperFactory());
052        register(new BoxedMapperFactory());
053        register(new PrimitiveMapperFactory());
054        register(new OptionalMapperFactory());
055        register(new EnumMapperFactory());
056        register(new NVarcharMapper());
057    }
058
059    @Override
060    public void setRegistry(ConfigRegistry registry) {
061        this.registry = registry;
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Returns the {@link JdbiInterceptionChainHolder} for the ColumnMapper inference. This chain allows registration of custom interceptors to change the standard
066     * type inference for the {@link ColumnMappers#register(ColumnMapper)} method.
067     */
068    @Alpha
069    public JdbiInterceptionChainHolder<ColumnMapper<?>, QualifiedColumnMapperFactory> getInferenceInterceptors() {
070        return inferenceInterceptors;
071    }
072
073    private ColumnMappers(ColumnMappers that) {
074        factories.addAll(that.factories);
075        cache.putAll(that.cache);
076        inferenceInterceptors.copy(that.inferenceInterceptors);
077        coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults = that.coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults;
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Register a column mapper which will have its parameterized type inspected to determine what it maps to.
082     * Column mappers may be reused by {@link RowMapper} to map individual columns.
083     * <p>
084     * The parameter must be concretely parameterized, we use the type argument T to
085     * determine if it applies to a given type.
086     *
087     * @param mapper the column mapper
088     * @return this
089     * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if the ColumnMapper is not a concretely parameterized type
090     */
091    public ColumnMappers register(ColumnMapper<?> mapper) {
092        QualifiedColumnMapperFactory factory = inferenceInterceptors.process(mapper);
093
094        return this.register(factory);
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Register a column mapper for a given explicit {@link GenericType}
099     * Column mappers may be reused by {@link RowMapper} to map individual columns.
100     *
101     * @param <T> the type
102     * @param type the generic type to match with equals.
103     * @param mapper the column mapper
104     * @return this
105     */
106    public <T> ColumnMappers register(GenericType<T> type, ColumnMapper<T> mapper) {
107        return this.register(ColumnMapperFactory.of(type.getType(), mapper));
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * Register a column mapper for a given explicit {@link Type}
112     * Column mappers may be reused by {@link RowMapper} to map individual columns.
113     *
114     * @param type the type to match with equals.
115     * @param mapper the column mapper
116     * @return this
117     */
118    public ColumnMappers register(Type type, ColumnMapper<?> mapper) {
119        return this.register(ColumnMapperFactory.of(type, mapper));
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Register a column mapper for a given {@link QualifiedType}
124     * Column mappers may be reused by {@link RowMapper} to map individual columns.
125     *
126     * @param type the type to match with equals.
127     * @param mapper the column mapper
128     * @return this
129     */
130    public <T> ColumnMappers register(QualifiedType<T> type, ColumnMapper<T> mapper) {
131        return this.register(QualifiedColumnMapperFactory.of(type, mapper));
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Register a column mapper factory.
136     * <p>
137     * Column mappers may be reused by {@link RowMapper} to map individual columns.
138     *
139     * @param factory the column mapper factory
140     * @return this
141     */
142    public ColumnMappers register(ColumnMapperFactory factory) {
143        return register(QualifiedColumnMapperFactory.adapt(factory));
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Register a qualified column mapper factory.
148     * <p>
149     * Column mappers may be reused by {@link RowMapper} to map individual columns.
150     *
151     * @param factory the qualified column mapper factory
152     * @return this
153     */
154    public ColumnMappers register(QualifiedColumnMapperFactory factory) {
155        factories.add(0, factory);
156        cache.clear();
157        return this;
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Obtain a column mapper for the given type.
162     *
163     * @param <T> the type to map
164     * @param type the target type to map to
165     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
166     */
167    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
168    public <T> Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> findFor(Class<T> type) {
169        ColumnMapper<T> mapper = (ColumnMapper<T>) findFor((Type) type).orElse(null);
170        return Optional.ofNullable(mapper);
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Obtain a column mapper for the given type.
175     *
176     * @param <T> the type to map
177     * @param type the target type to map to
178     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
179     */
180    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
181    public <T> Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> findFor(GenericType<T> type) {
182        ColumnMapper<T> mapper = (ColumnMapper<T>) findFor(type.getType()).orElse(null);
183        return Optional.ofNullable(mapper);
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * Obtain a column mapper for the given type.
188     *
189     * @param type the target type to map to
190     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
191     */
192    public Optional<ColumnMapper<?>> findFor(Type type) {
193        return findFor(QualifiedType.of(type)).map(m -> (ColumnMapper<?>) m);
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Obtain a column mapper for the given qualified type.
198     *
199     * @param type the qualified target type to map to
200     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
201     */
202    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
203    public <T> Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> findFor(QualifiedType<T> type) {
204        // ConcurrentHashMap can enter an infinite loop on nested computeIfAbsent calls.
205        // Since column mappers can decorate other column mappers, we have to populate the cache the old fashioned way.
206        // See https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8062841, https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8142175
207        Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> cached = (Optional) cache.get(type);
208
209        if (cached != null) {
210            return cached;
211        }
212
213        Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> mapper = (Optional) factories.stream()
214                .flatMap(factory -> JdbiOptionals.stream(factory.build(type, registry)))
215                .findFirst();
216
217        mapper.ifPresent(m -> m.init(registry));
218
219        cache.put(type, mapper);
220
221        return mapper;
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Returns true if database {@code null} values should be transformed to the default value for primitives.
226     *
227     * @return {@code true} if database {@code null}s should translate to the Java defaults for primitives, or throw an exception otherwise.
228     *
229     * Default value is true: nulls will be coalesced to defaults.
230     */
231    public boolean getCoalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults() {
232        return coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults;
233    }
234
235    public void setCoalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults(boolean coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults) {
236        this.coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults = coalesceNullPrimitivesToDefaults;
237    }
238
239    @Override
240    public ColumnMappers createCopy() {
241        return new ColumnMappers(this);
242    }
243}
